intro: Stachys palustris var. imaii, commonly known as the marsh woundwort, is a perennial herb native to wetland habitats in eastern North America. It features slender, upright stems that are often reddish in color and bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, pale purple to pink flowers in whorled clusters along the stem, typically blooming from June to August. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to thrive in moist, often saturated soils. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in wetland restoration projects.
